docs.lead_paragraph: She has been in state care since she was 5 years old, and is described by the authorities as a frequent runaway from foster and group homes. Her mother died in January. Her father is absent. Now, this 14-year-old ward of the state is at the heart of a highly charged public debate in Arizona because a local judge has granted her request for a late-term abortion. The case is being watched by those on both sides of the abortion issue because of the girl's age and the controversy over late-term abortions.

headline.main: Girl Is Focus Of the Debate On Abortion

docs.abstract: 14-year-old ward of the state is focus of highly charged public debate in Arizona because local judge has granted her request for a late-term abortion; case is being watched closely by both sides of abortion issue because of girl's age and controversy over late-term abortions; Arizona officials confirm that Judge William Sargeant of Maricopa County Superior Court had ordered state welfare workers to send girl, who is 24 weeks pregnant, out of state to have abortion; state law allows late-term abortions, but doctors in Arizona generally do not perform them past 20 weeks; girl's request was granted after court was told that pregnancy was result of rape (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Q: You stunned a lot of people by going back to work two weeks after your second daughter was born -- and going back onstage three weeks after that. Was that a difficult decision for you? Or was it inevitable? That's it exactly. That was in a period when I had intense feelings of ambition, which have been tempered a bit now. I just thought, I can't miss that opening night. I don't even really know how I did it. Except that by nature I'm positive. And I think women in general are very good at multi-tasking.

headline.main: The Way We Live Now: 8-29-99: Questions for Renee Fleming; Lullabye Diva

docs.abstract: Article, in question and answer format, on Renee Fleming discusses her career and her life at home raising two daughters; photo (M)
